intro: Campanula sphaerothrix, commonly known as the globe bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive spherical, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campanula sphaerothrix is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
